title: House Democrats Release Epstein’s Birthday Letter Apparently Signed by Trump
summary: The Oversight Committee released files turned over by Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, including a copy of a sexually suggestive note apparently signed by President Trump.

title: Trump Denies Epstein Birthday Drawing, but Signature Matches Personal Letters
summary: Donald Trump’s signature has evolved over the years, but when signing just his first name, he often includes the same flourish at the end.

title: In Epstein’s ‘Birthday Book,’ a Celebration of His Lecherous Exploits
summary: The book containing 50th birthday tributes to Jeffrey Epstein was released on Monday by the House Oversight Committee.

title: Lachlan Murdoch Secures Control of Fox and News Corp, Ending Succession Fight
summary: Lachlan Murdoch will take control of a new family trust in a deal worth $3.3 billion, ensuring that his father’s media empire will retain its conservative slant.

title: The Murdoch Succession Fight Is Over. So What Does Lachlan Control?
summary: From Fox News to Tubi to HarperCollins, here’s what is in the media empire that Rupert Murdoch built.

title: 12th Grade Reading Skills Hit a New Low
summary: High school seniors had the worst reading scores since 1992 on a national test, a loss probably related to increases in screen time and the pandemic. Their math scores fell as well.

title: Supreme Court Lifts Restrictions on L.A. Immigration Stops
summary: A federal judge had ordered agents not to make indiscriminate stops relying on factors like a person’s ethnicity or that they speak Spanish.

title: The Supreme Court Decision on ICE and Racial Profiling, Explained
summary: The ruling allowed immigration agents to stop people for reasons that lower courts had deemed likely unconstitutional.

title: Adams Administration Move to Let ICE Into Rikers Is Illegal, Judge Rules
summary: Justice Mary V. Rosado said the order, issued after the mayor’s corruption charges were dropped by the Trump administration, presented the appearance of a conflict of interest.

title: Meet the New ICE Recruits
summary: ICE was hiring officers in Texas, part of a huge ramp-up to its work force. The Times was there.

title: Is America Ready for Japanese-Style 7-Elevens?
summary: Stephen Dacus, head of the chain’s parent company, aims to export its success in Japan, with signature offerings like fresh prepared food.

title: Why 7-Eleven and Convenience Stores in Japan Are So Special
summary: Convenience stores are a fixture of Japanese life, and 7-Eleven is the country’s dominant chain. They are a place to shop, pay bills and gather during disasters.

title: Trump Says Having ‘a Little Fight With the Wife’ Should Not Count as a Crime
summary: President Trump said that offenses that happen at home should not undermine his record of crime reduction in Washington.

title: Trump’s Treasury Secretary Threatens to Punch Housing Official in the Face
summary: The dust-up, at a members-only club in Georgetown, was not the first time Scott Bessent has shown a hot temper.

title: Thune Moves to Speed Trump Nominees Past Democratic Blockade
summary: Republicans said the maneuver to change the Senate’s rules, the latest step that would weaken the filibuster, was necessary to overcome Democratic obstruction of President Trump’s nominees.

title: Wealthy N.Y. Developers Call Meeting to Plot Mamdani’s Defeat
summary: Some of New York’s largest landlords will convene on Tuesday morning for an urgent gathering to support former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, saying the “time to act is now.”

title: Mamdani, Facing Mistrust Within the N.Y.P.D., Reaches Out to Officers
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, has been speaking with officers to address concerns over his past criticism of the Police Department.

title: France’s Government Has Collapsed. What Comes Next?
summary: President Emmanuel Macron is expected to appoint a new prime minister, rejecting calls for elections or his resignation.

title: Ukrainian Refugee Stabbing in North Carolina Ignites a Firestorm on the Right
summary: Security footage capturing the unprovoked stabbing in Charlotte became an accelerant for conservative arguments about the perceived failings of Democratic policies.

title: The Political Signals Russia Sends With Each Huge Barrage on Ukraine
summary: Analysts have linked major attacks to important geopolitical events as the Kremlin tries to strengthen its hand in talks.

title: Firefighters Race to Save a Treasured Sequoia Grove in California
summary: Giant sequoias can live for thousands of years, but wildfires have killed staggering numbers of the trees in recent years.

title: Thai Court Orders Thaksin, Ex-Premier, to Serve One Year in Prison
summary: The Supreme Court’s ruling stemmed from a prior conviction and was the latest blow for Thaksin Shinawatra.

title: France’s Government Has Fallen. It Really Didn’t Have To.
summary: A solution to France’s fiscal and political stalemate has been hiding in plain sight.

title: These Peace Negotiators Say It’s Time to Give Up on the Two-State Solution
summary: The talk of two states may be an alibi, not an aspiration.

title: Social Media Goes Back Online in Nepal After 19 Are Killed in Protests
summary: The government reversed its ban on Facebook, Instagram and other platforms, which helped to spark demonstrations by young people who were also angry about corruption.

title: A.I. Could Make the Smartphone Passé. What Comes Next?
summary: As Apple prepares to release new iPhones this week, industry veterans shared their predictions for what will be the next big thing in personal computing.

title: Webb Telescope Studies Hopeful Hint of Earthlike Atmosphere on Trappist-1e Planet
summary: Scientists are steadily ruling out habitable conditions on the seven planets of the star Trappist-1. On one of the worlds, a nitrogen gas-rich veil remains a possibility.

title: Man Killed Retired Auburn Professor at Alabama Dog Park, Police Say
summary: Harold Rashad Dabney III was arrested Sunday on two counts of capital murder in the death of Dr. Julie Schnuelle, 59, a veterinarian and mother whose body was found in a dog park on Saturday.
